When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
caf_matched <- read.csv("~/Downloads/CAF_subpopulation_data - Patient_matching (1).csv")
caf_matched$Sample[duplicated(caf_matched$Sample)]
caf_matched_3808 <- caf_matched %>% dplyr::filter(Study == "EGAD00001003808")
caf_matched_3808_tumour <- caf_matched_3808 %>% dplyr::filter(Tumor_JuxtaTumor == "tumor")
caf_matched_3808_juxtatumor <- caf_matched_3808 %>% dplyr::filter(Tumor_JuxtaTumor == "juxtatumor")
n_distinct(caf_matched_3808_tumour$Patient)
n_distinct(caf_matched_3808_juxtatumor$Patient)
```
